name: Zainab Fasiki
description: Born in Fez in 1994, Zainab Fasiki is a trained mechanical engineer who has seamlessly blended her technical background with her passion for art and activism. After graduating from the National School of Electricity and Mechanics (ENSEM) in Casablanca, she pursued a career in mechanical engineering. However, her experiences with societal challenges led her to become a prominent graphic artist and women's rights activist. Her acclaimed graphic novel Hshouma addresses taboos and advocates for gender equality in Morocco. Fasiki's work has garnered international recognition, including being named a TIME magazine 'Next Generation Leader' in 2019.
